bg.x2d.anim

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.x2d.anim.Animation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable

    public class Animation
extends Object
implements Drawable
    A collection of Segments that perform operations on a Graphics object's transform to create timed animation effects. The Segments provided will be played in order over their respective time durations. When the Animation is drawn, the current cumulative changes made to the AffineTransform of the Graphics object are applied, and when released, the original Graphics transform is restored. This allows for independent Animations per drawn object in a simple, managed time model.
    Since:
    2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(List<Segment> segments,
         boolean autoLoop)
        Creates this animation with the given segments.
        Parameters:
        segments - the Segments of this animation. Must contain all Segments when this constructor is called. An internal list is created with the contents of the given list, so any changes made to the given list will not be reflected in the Animation queue.
        autoLoop - if true this animation will automatically reset after completion, else the responsibility will be left to the caller.

      • Animation

        public Animation(Segment[] segments,
         boolean autoLoop)
        Creates this animation with the given segments.
        Parameters:
        segments - the Segments of this animation. Must contain all Segments when this constructor is called. An internal list is created with the contents of the given list, so any changes made to the given list will not be reflected in the Animation queue.
        autoLoop - if true this animation will automatically reset after completion, else the responsibility will be left to the caller.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(Graphics2D g2d)
        Initiates the transformation for whatever Segment is currently in effect and sets the transform on the given Graphics2D object. Everything drawn between when this method is called and release is called will be affected by the transformations of this Animation.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Drawable

      • release

        public void release(Graphics2D g2d)
        Resets the original AffineTranform of the Graphics2D object so the transformations will no longer affect it.
        Parameters:
        g2d -

      • resetAll

        public void resetAll()
        Calls reset on all of the Segments in this Animation's dump queue, if and only if this Animation is finished. This must be called before this Animation will play again.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Checks to see if this Animation is finished (all Segments have completed).
        Returns:
        true if finished, false otherwise.

      • getCurrentSegment

        public Segment getCurrentSegment()
        Fetches the currently active Segment in this Animation.
        Returns:
        the Segment in effect during this Animation's time frame.

      • advance

        protected void advance()
        Advances the current Segment by calling its transform method. Also performs checks on the the Segment's validity and moves to the next Segment if it has been finished. Does nothing if all Segments have finished.
